label: 局
本: Yoshiwara: The Glittering World of the Japanese Courtesan . University of Hawai'i Press . 1993
説明文: In the hierarchy of prostitutes until the early eighteenth century, the rank between kōshi and hashi. They operated in a small compartment called tsubone. Originally the apartments of court ladies of the Heian period, the term tsubone during the Edo period was also part of the names of high-ranking ladies-in-waiting in Edo Castle who were given individual apartments (Kasuga no Tsubone, for example). [格子、端、春日局]
